Optimize Spatio-Temporal Parameters for Variable Pairs

Source: R/GRF_helper_functions.R
optimize_pairs_spatiotemporal.Rd

Optimizes spatio-temporal model parameters for each pair of variables to enhance the log-likelihood of the observed data under the model. This function focuses on both spatial and temporal interactions between pairs of variables, refining the model's ability to capture complex spatio-temporal dependencies.

optimize_pairs_spatiotemporal(par_all, data, names, Vi, uh, cr, max_it, ep)

Arguments

par_all

Initial comprehensive set of model parameters to be refined through optimization.

data

Dataset containing spatio-temporal observations, typically a 3D array or list with dimensions representing locations, times, and variables.

names

Vector containing the names of the variables considered in the model, indicating the scope of the optimization.

Vi

Matrix specifying variable pairs, directing the optimization towards relevant variable interactions.

uh

Matrix that combines spatial and temporal distances with additional identifiers, essential for defining the context of each data point in spatio-temporal space.

cr

Initial correlation matrix offering a preliminary estimate of relationships between variables, serving as a foundation for optimization.

max_it

Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the optimization process, setting a limit to ensure computational feasibility.

ep

Data frame defining pairs of variables for detailed analysis, guiding the optimization process by highlighting specific interactions of interest.

Value

Updated `par_all` vector containing optimized parameters for each variable pair, representing an enhanced set of model parameters post-optimization. This updated parameter set is ready for subsequent model application or further analysis.

Contents
